did.unittitle: Indiana University Mortar Board Alumnae Club records

origination.label: Creator
origination.corpname: Indiana University Mortar Board Alumnae Club.

did.abstract: The Mortar Board Alumnae Club collection includes an address list of members, ledgers, club records, newsletters, newspaper clippings and a historical synopsis of the organization.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: Collection is open for research. Advance notice required.

bioghist.head: Administrative History
bioghist.p: Mortar Board, Inc. is a national honor society that recognizes college seniors for their achievements in scholarship, leadership, and service. Originally open only to women, in 1975, the group admitted men. The Indiana University chapter was established in 1921 to "promote interest in scholarship, campus activity and womanliness." Still active on campus today, the IU chapter is now known as the Mrs. Granville Wells Chapter, named for Anna Bernice Wells, mother of IU's much loved Herman B Wells.

On May 11, 1938, Louise Wylie, Jean Schmalz, Alice Binkley and Catherine Royer met over lunch to discuss the possibility of establishing an alumnae club for the group. Less than a month later, the Mortar Board Alumnae Club was officially established with the election of officers and collection of dues. Based on the group's minutes, the early goal appeared to be primarily one of support for the actives. The last records in the collection date to 1966, but it is unknown if an Alumnae Club still exists or when it went inactive.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Collection is organized into one series.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: The material of the Indiana University Mortar Board Alumnae Club consists of one series of Administrative files (1936-1966).

This small collection contains several membership lists that had been composed or revised throughout the organization's existence. The most comprehensive list includes honorary and annual member names and addresses from 1921 to 1950. Another list was compiled by Mrs. Leon Wallace for the years 1950-1951 with an addendum for missing members from 1924 to 1947. In 1961, an abbreviated list of the names and addresses of 1922 -23 members was completed. Two lists containing member names and addresses for the years 1926 and 1936 are also part of the collection.
Catherine Royer's notebook contains a type written copy of the organization's constitution, financial reports for 1939-40, and the monthly program from October 1941 to May 1942.

Other materials included in the collection are a Mortar Board Newsletter from 1952 published by the Bloomington Alumnae chapter which previews plans for the group's thirtieth reunion, lists scholarship award winners, honors deceased members, and provides updates on members.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p: Additional records such as newsletters, annual reports, bulletins, and publications may be accessed in the Archives of Institutional Memory
Related photographs may be available in the University Archives Photographs Database

userestrict.head: Usage Restrictions
userestrict.p: For information regarding the copyright status of this collection, please contact the Indiana University Archives staff.

The Indiana University Archives respects the intellectual property rights of others and does not claim any copyrights for non-university records, materials in the public domain, or materials for which we do not hold a Deed of Gift. Responsibility for the determination of the copyright status of these materials rests with those persons wishing to reuse the materials. Researchers are responsible for securing permission from copyright owners and any other rights holders for any reuse of these materials that extends beyond fair use or other statutory limitations.

Digital reproductions of archival materials from the Indiana University Archives are made available for noncommercial educational and research purposes only. If you are the copyright holder for any of the digitized materials and have questions about its inclusion on our site, please contact the Indiana University Archivist.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Item], Indiana University Mortar Board Alumnae Club records, Collection C475, Indiana University Archives, Bloomington.

custodhist.head: Provenance
custodhist.p: Accession 7019 transferred to the University Archives in August 1995.
